perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, EmployeeCo employs certain individuals (the "Services Employees") who provide management, operational and administrative services as necessary to operate the business of the Operating Company and its affiliates (the "Services").
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, EmployeeCo employs certain individuals (the "Staff") who provide management, operational and administrative services as necessary to operate the business of the Operating Company and its affiliates (the "Services").
perturbation.explanation: The contract initially defines employees providing services as "Services Employees." Changing this to "Staff" creates confusion whether the "Services Employees" and "Staff" are the same, impacting the clarity of EmployeeCo's obligations regarding these individuals, especially concerning reimbursements.

This section now uses "Staff", "Services Employees" and "personnel benefits" interchangeably in the same list, causing confusion. It's not clear whether "Staff" and "Services Employees" are distinct groups, and what benefits are included under 'personnel benefits' for 'Services Employees.' This creates uncertainty regarding the exact costs that the Operating Company is obligated to reimburse.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be terminated by (a) the written agreement of the Parties or (b) by either Party upon 5 days written notice to the other Party. All payment obligations hereunder shall survive the termination of this Agreement in accordance with their respective terms.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be terminated by (a) the written agreement of the Parties or (b) by EmployeeCo upon 5 days written notice to the Operating Company. All payment obligations hereunder shall survive the termination of this Agreement in accordance with their respective terms.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement allows *either* Party to terminate, while the modified version restricts termination to EmployeeCo. This introduces a contradiction, as it's unclear whether the Operating Company also has the right to terminate. This creates uncertainty regarding the termination rights of each party and could lead to disputes.
